purpleculture_pinyin:
zhāi
to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc; vegetarian diet; study room; building; to give alms (to a monk)
поститься или воздерживаться от мяса, вина и т. д .; вегетарианская диета; кабинет; строительство; подавать милостыню (монаху)

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The highlander has a rigid healthy diet and can abstain from food which is unhealthy except for honey combs.
humanum_short_description_en: " Zhai " is a pictographic word. See "Caihou Pan" (CHANT-10171-6) in the late Spring and Autumn Period in bronze inscriptions, and "Curse Chu Wen" and "Juyan Han Bamboo Slips (A920)" for other ancient characters. "Said the text": "fast, quit, Jie also from the show, Qi provincial sound." According to inscriptions from the " show " from " Qi beginning of the text", and not " homogeneous " province. From Xu Shen's explanation, Zhaiying originally referred to the ancients' fasting before practicing religious rituals in order to cleanse themselves, and " showing " refers to the hope that through fasting, the gods can be cleared. In ancient times, Zhai often wrote " Qi ". For example, in "Zhuangzi·Qiwu Lun", there was the phrase "the Qi of sacrifices, but the Qi of the heart." In addition, there is a saying in "Mawangdui‧ Fifty-Two Prescriptions for Sickness" that "Qi (fast) precepts must be good". The original image of " Qi " is wheat grain, and its use to relieve " Zhai " should only be a homophonic relationship.
humanum_short_description: 「齋」是一形聲字。金文見春秋晚期「蔡侯盤」(CHANT-10171-6)，其他古文字形見「詛楚文」、「居延漢簡(甲920)」等。《說文》：「齋， 戒，潔也。从示，齊省聲。」按金文從「示」從「齊」的初文，非「齊」省。從許慎的解釋看，齋應原指古人行宗教禮儀之前禁食以自潔之舉，從「示」是指希望透過齋戒以通神明。在古代，齋又常寫作「齊」，如《莊子‧齊物論》中即有：「是祭祀之齊，非心齊也」一語。此外「馬王堆‧五十二病方」中亦有「必善齊（齋）戒」之說。「齊」的原象禾麥穀粒，其用作解「齋」應只是同音假借的關係。

齋 (Simplified: 斋)
Pinyin: zhāi
English Definition: to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc; vegetarian diet; study room; building; to give alms (to a monk)
Total strokes: 17; Radical: 齊
Pictophonetic: 小 (even) indicates the sound; 齊 conveys the meaning.

    • 小 [ xiǎo ] small, tiny, insignificant

齋戒 [ zhāi jiè ]: to fast

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 齋 mutant 亝 from (rem- 文 wén)(rem- 厽 léi) and (rem- 而 ér)(rem- 二 èr) from altar 示 shì and related phonetic even-grain (齐)齊𠫼 qí C737 齋<亝> A320 斋[齋] simp 斋.

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(many variants qi and zhai confused) (originally evenly spaced stalks of grain 𠫸) (add 二 indicating evenness qi) (- add 示 indicating eating zhai)

Simplification rule : A320 斋[齋]

齋字的基本解释

齋
zhāi
见“斋”。

齋字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhāi］
［《廣韻》側皆切，平皆，莊。］
亦作“夈1”。“斋1”的繁体字。亦作“齊3”。
(1)古人在祭祀或举行其他典礼前清心寡欲，净身洁食，以示庄敬。
(2)谓去除杂念，使心神纯一。参见“齋心”。
(3)庄敬。
(4)谓敬畏恐惧。参见“齋慄”。
(5)专指僧道或其信徒诵经拜忏、祷祀求福等活动。
(6)佛教语。佛制：比丘过午皆不许食，因以午前、午中之食为斋。按小乘戒律，只禁过午食，而不禁食净肉。后人据大乘别意，以素食为斋。
(7)布施。施舍饭食给僧、道或穷苦人。
(8)家居的房屋。
(9)学舍。
(10)斋宫的简称。参见“齋宫”。
(11)用于商店的名称。
(12)通“”。

齋字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【齊字部】　齋； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1531第12
【廣韻】側皆切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】莊皆切，?債平聲。【正韻】潔也，莊也，恭也。【廣雅】齋，敬也。【禮·祭統】齋之爲言齊也。【易·繫辭】聖人以此齋戒。【註】洗心曰齋。　又【後漢·輿服志】有齋冠曰長冠。　又燕居之室曰齋。　又【集韻】【正韻】?津私切，音貲。【孟子】齋疏之服。【趙岐註】卽齋縗也。音資。　又【易·履卦】得其資斧。【子夏傳】作齊斧。虞喜志林云：當作齋。齋戒入廟而受斧也。　又叶眞而切，音支。【後漢·周澤傳】生世不諧，作太常妻，一年三百六十日，三百五十九日齋。○按《說文》示齊爲齋。示，明也，祗也。齊者，萬物之潔齊也。洪武《正韻》云：古單作齊，後人于其下加立心，以別之耳。

齋字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
齋字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
fast
zhāi

fast
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhāi］
["Guangyun" has all sides cut, flat all, and Zhuang. ]
Also known as "夈1". The traditional characters of "Zhai 1". Also known as "Qi 3".
(1) The ancients were clear of their hearts and desires before offering sacrifices or other ceremonies, purifying their bodies and eating kosher food, to show respect.
(2) It means that distracting thoughts are removed and the mind is pure. See "Zhaixin".
(3) Zhuang Jing.
(4) It is called awe and fear. See "Zai Li".
(5) It refers specifically to activities such as monk Taoism or its followers chanting sutras, worshipping, praying for blessings, etc.
(6) Buddhist language. Buddhist system: Bhikkhus are not allowed to eat at noon, because they eat food before noon and noon as fasting. According to the Hinayana precepts, only lunch is forbidden, not pure meat. According to Mahayana, later generations used vegetarian food as their fast.
(7) Giving. Give meals to monks, Taoists or poor people.
(8) Houses for home.
(9) Schools.
(10) Abbreviation for Zhai Palace. See "Zai Palace".
(11) The name used for the store.
(12) Pass "".
fast

[Note] Washing the heart is called Zhai.　[Later Han·Yufu Zhi] There is a Zhaiguan called a long crown.　The room of Yanju is called Zhai.　 [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun]? Jin private cut, sound. [Later Han·Zhou Ze Chuan] Disharmony in life and life, and be the wife of Taichang, three hundred and sixty days a year, three hundred and fifty-nine days of fast. ○Press "Shuowen" to show Qi as a fast. Show, Ming Ye, only Ye. If all things are together, everything is clean. Hong Wu's "Zheng Yun" says: The ancient singles are made together, and later generations add their hearts to them, and other ears.
